title: Simcity5
body: The Simcity 4 game is great since it is played off line, Simcity 5 sucks, server issues all the time, no good support from EA, The server technology today is to primitive for millions of people to play online. EA should have kept this game with an off line option. I returned it with a letter to the CEO of EA. The graphics look good, but with poor server connections not being available 45%  of the time, it's a waste of money. It is like putting a Mercury Engine into an old Ford Pinto. Same with this, primitive server technology and a good game do not work well together. This game should have had an off line option. I will never purchase another EA game until major improvements have been made to the technologies of online gaming or an off line version is available. EA will have a lot of returns of this game.OK after playing this game online it is OK, still would like the off line version to be released

title: Pathetic Performance!
body: All I want to do is play this game by myself, but still I have to use a server. I join the other reviewers to say how AWFUL the server connections are! They are eithe busy, or throw you off the game once it starts. Most incredibly of all, I lost all the cities I had set up in between lost connections! After trying to play this game for the past five days, it took me to the tutorial on start up tonight, then disconnected. POOR!!! Looks like a great game...if I ever get to play it without interruption!

title: Can't play...
body: Just leaving my 1 star review.  Have had this this game for over 48 hours and have only connected once for a few minutes.  Was immediately kicked out because 'the SimCity servers are currently down, trying to reconnect.'Terrible game from a terrible company.  But there is zero chance they will ever read this.  They are reading their bank statements.

title: A bit of work but fine if you spend a few days on it.
body: I watched several YouTube videos BEFORE I purchased this.  Excellent source: Quill18.If you are new to Sim City, it is could be difficult to manage the game unless you watch some videos, as there is NO guidebook on how the software features work.It took me 1/2 hour to load the software and endless patches on a Windows 7 pc via FIOS.I don't care for region play--you have to toggle back and forth a LOT so that your first city doesn't go bankrupt.I don't region play is realistic after all most large cities have no shared schools, universities, police/fire services.I was prepared for a LOT of glitches after watching hours of said videos BEFORE I purchased this and was pleasantly surprised.There is a useful function where you can access the internet while playing to Google questions about the game. Again, EA provides NO documentation re the features.A negative--whenever you boot up your PC, the software shortcut auto-loads at bottom of the screen which slows my pc boot up time.Lots of fun. but make sure you have a watch handy--the system does not show real time as you play!

title: Save your $ for a prostitute who will at least screw you the way you want.
body: I paid good money for this game and cannot play because EA failed to provide the infrastructure to support it.When I tried to contact customer service (online chat and phone at the same time) to request a refund for this fraud, I received the message that my wait was under five minutes, then it suddenly jumped to over 300 minutes.Don't bother.(Wait. What? I have to give it a star? It doesn't warrant any!)

title: I'm not mad, I'm just disappointed.....
body: I've been a lont time fan of the 'SIm City franchise' for quite some time.  Although I've never been able to get many sky scrapers in my towns, and Illiteracy runs rampent.  I thought that with this new game I would fix my course and become mayor of the coolest cities ever.  Little did I know I would need constant connection to the internet, WTF?  It's 2013, the internet is reliable enough everywhere in the country (USA) to demand players be online to plays this.  I will NEVER BUY ANOTHER EA GAME AGAIN, VALVE JUST GAINED A NEW CUSTOMER

title: ZERO
body: I'd give it a zero if I could. Being a huge SimCity fan, I was thrilled to learn there was a new one. Unfortunately, it's always uploading, which takes forever. Then, when I do get the play option, servers are down or I get kicked out. Very sad. Very expensive game that sits on my computer unused. If I could return it, I would.

title: SimCity LE doesn't start
body: Maybe this is what they mean by 'limited edition' but the game only starts once in about 10 tries.  It is one of those 'persistantly online' games so if there is any glitch in your internet access, you have to restart (and Good Luck with that).  There is no offline purely single player mode.  This game is the Facebook of scenario simulators.Another major complaint is that the whole thing runs through an 'Origin' front-end application which plasters a daily advertisement in the middle of your screen while the game loads (or chooses not to load depending on how lucky you are).I paid $59 for this garbage.  This is not some $2.99 iPhone app. You don't get to pester me with Ads and 'friend' requests.

title: DRM Sucks
body: Took me over an hour to get through the demo game to actually start playing the game due to the poor quality of the DRM.

title: Stay away
body: The advanced security measures are not necessary and make the game unplayable. The legitimate fans like us are the ones that can't play the game and will stay away from future products.

title: EA is Terrible
body: This always online thing is such bulls***. I paid for the game and cannot play it. EA needs to stop this immediately and make it a stand alone game. Worse idea EVER! and now look at whats happening, its on pace to receiving the worst amazon rating ever.

title: Can't play it when you want to
body: Going a trip and don't have wifi? Forget playing this game. Even though it's the ultimate single player game you need to stayed connected all the time (when EA servers don't crash). What a joke. Save you cash and wait till they offer a free version in 10 years.

title: Creator of sim city
body: Not the game I wanted to make. Please sign the petition to rid the always online DRM that destroyed my most recent creation!

title: Have not bought or played it but joining the mob.
body: Seems EA Failed with this game, so save your $$ and move on and hopefully they so the Sim series right!

title: Unplayable
body: The whole world shouted from the rooftops, don't force us online. Don't waste what looks to be amazing concepts and gameplay into a format that will inevitably crash and burn like Diablo 3 did. We warned the executives of EA not to punish paying customers.They didnt listen. What a joke these dumbasses are.It all looks so promising. It really does. Three of us excitedly got back from work and tried to add each other as friends. But the servers were buggy and full of errors. Servers told us it couldn't create cities for us to play in. We were all online and Friends on Origin but within the game, none of us could see each other or join each other's games.Once we were finally able to create one after a stroke of luck, we were told our cities were lost in the server. When we joined another server hoping it would work, we were greeted as if we never had played the game. The tutorial played again, and the region our city was in was completely gone.So... We couldn't play the game. We couldn't save the cities. We couldn't join each other's game. But, EA could verify that we were a paying customer.What did I pay $60 for again? That's right, I paid $60 that EA execs think they are entitled to without giving customers a working product. I paid $60 to the EA execs so I could be treated like a criminal under EA's constant-online DRM.EA already had a blowback like this with Spore. I'm speechless how these executives get paid millions to produce disasters like this. Speechless.Amazon, I hope you can refund my $60. I'm going to try and hurt these execs' pockets as much as possible.

title: Love It!
body: I really enjoy this game. You cannot judge a game like this within the first few days and be able to really do it justice. The reason is this: It is an online game. No matter how much beta testing you have to try to crash the servers, on that first day it will always crash. it has for other big name games (Diablo III anyone). After a few days, it gets solved.Here are my thoughts about the game:Pros:1. I get to play with my fiance. We won't play at the same time BUT when I'm not playing, he can play in the same region and help MY city while he plays instead of him playing my city and screwing it up (he does that often)2. I get to focus on the quality of my city instead of trying to fill out my city and having a lot of run down parts. Right now I have half my city full and it is thriving and growing very quickly which is VERY exciting!3. The new updates to the game are GREAT. I love how I can just click update road and update the section of road I want. No more having to go and draw new lines, get rid of established places, etc. This is amazing.4. I love the objectives. I feel bad when I don't get them BUT I really enjoy the achievements and objectives.5. Being able to help the people of the city. I love being able to prepare for fireworks or block parties. I also enjoy seeing their thoughts and helping them!6. their smile faces. When I add something good, their faces go up and they become happy.Cons:1. Always online. I'm not the biggest fan of that. Due to it, I had to wait 2 hours until my game was fully updated last night.2. Subways. I do miss the subways but I understand due to the map size it really wouldn't be possible.3. complaints being a little vague. I had a protest at my city hall due to not collecting trash. I added more trucks and dumps and it still didn't fix it. I wish they would tell me exactly how to do that.I do not have many cons. I played for about 3+ hours last night and I had no problems with the game. I had fun the entire time. I think this is a good base for the game and it will continue to evolve with updates and DLC.

title: SimCity
body: I had SimCity for years and this version is much improved.  However I find that there are too many options to play this game.  It is a little more complicated.  Other than that it is OK.

title: terrible
body: Choo Choo! Now here comes all of the the downvotes. Seriously this is the absolute worst release of all time.

title: If i could even play.
body: I would be able to give a review if i could even play the game. I have more fun with paint and i'm color blind.

title: Buyer Beware: Online Only to play Single Player! Saves are Cloud-based, and delete randomly. DO NOT BUY!
body: This game requires you to be online to play AND SAVE. They can and will DELETE your saved game you spent many hours on. I will NOT change this one star review until saves are local, on my PC, and offline play is available. You deserve this EA. You hurt us buyers with online DRM. DO NOT BUY!!!!

title: Cool rollbacks bro
body: My favorite bug out of the hundreds from this game is the rollback. I love putting 8 hours into a game and then having it whipped away because I have to be connected to over crowded servers.

title: Numerous problems, but a pretty okay game
body: I would not recommend getting the box version. They ship you a CD which contains the Origin installer. Once you install Origin, Origin updates. After Origin restarts, you can download your game. Once you download the game, the game has to update multiple times with a reboot after each time. Finally, if you are trying to play at peak hours, you can't you get placed in a queue. However, when the timer on the queue expires, you just get placed back on the end of it.Overall, it takes way too long to actually start playing the game, and installing from a CD won't help any.I ended up logging into the European servers because they were the only ones working.Once you do finally play, the game is pretty decent. Traffic can be a little silly. And if region play is disabled, you can forget about getting above 200k sims in a city or building a great work.Generally, I had fun, but am not in love. With the $20 discount for pre-releases on amazon, I'd say it was worth it.

title: March 10th evening download
body: Hi everyone! I purchased my copy of Sim City on via the Maxis/EA website. The original update took about 20 minutes (a little long considering the game was just released) however, since then I have not experienced any major issues since then.  As of today (3/12/13) there are about 20 servers up and running at Origin and I have not had issues getting on any of them.  I really wish EA/Maxis/Origin had done a better job at launch, this game had so much great buzz around it, they had to have been able to anticipate that the servers would be overloaded at launch - unaccpetable.  I read everyone elses frustrations before purchasing my copy...and almost didn't.  That being said, now that some of dust has settled and people might actually be able to start playing I hope that they can enjoy the game as much as I am.  It truly is the best Sim City to date.  So many wonderful features and add on's from the fourth version.  The ability to totally control your city is so wonderful and the gameplay and graphics are smooth and simply beautiful. I love this series and have played every version.  I really hope that EA/Maxis/Origin takes a long look at what happened here.  They took a wonderful product and created a horrible stigma around it that is not going to go away anytime soon.

title: I threw it on the ground!
body: I bought this game not knowing about the requirement of needing an internet connection at all times - SO I THREW IT ON THE GROUND! MAAAAN I ain't part of your system!

title: EA ruins every game they touch.
body: This game is absolutely nonsense. Complete rubbish and dimwittery. I'm absolutely flabberghasted that they would try and compose a mockery such as this.

title: The worst experience is no experience...
body: I bought this game thinking I could play it - after all, I have a laptop beefy enough to handle most anything I throw at it. To my surprise and utter dismay, this game is literally a BRICK (actually less useful than a brick) unless you have a good internet connection.A few things about this... for one, my internet connection (at home and otherwise) is often poor and intermittent (I live in the USA)... furthermore, many times I simply have no access such as when I travel for work (airport, airplane, etc)... so already the game's usability is shot. On top of all this - I simply don't want a cloud-only based game. I want my save files and I want my backup of my save files... Had I known what EA did to SimCity, I would not have bought this in the first place.I was really looking forward to countless hours in this release of SimCity... very sad.

title: Let's get it down!
body: This is the worst piece of crap ever. Honestly though, I just want to see it be the worst rated thing ever.

title: Horrible RDM
body: Do yourself a favor and buy Tropico 4 from Steam.  Or, wait until EA removed the online requirement and adds larger maps.

title: Scam attempt
body: This is almost a scam attempt. You can't lose, you can't play with the DRMs, if you manage to get in the server you most probably will occur in ROLLBACKS and lost cities. Way to go, EA.

title: Buying this was the worst decision i've ever made
body: Literally. Could have spent the money on much better city builders. First Spore, now this? Leave it to EA to take an incredible idea and then butcher it to the point where there is barely any resemblance.

title: Eh
body: It's good but the server side crap sucks and no mod-ability.  Additionally they will force you to buy DLC to get bigger cities and these server problems are ridiculous.  Got it the day it was released, box copy from Amazon, and I've managed to play maybe 3 hours.  Not cool.

title: It's fun if you like reading 'Server down!'.
body: What a piece of junk. I spent $80 PLUS installed VMware and windows on my mac so I could play this when it came out. And what did EA give me back? A game that does not work. Servers down. Servers down. Cannot connect.Save your money til EA releases a version that can play WITHOUT the server!

title: Botched Launch, but Still...
body: UPDATE: With over a month into the game and the latest 2.0 patch, I have to report that it is still largely unplayable in most forms. The only way you can effectively play is either with a single city by yourself, or if your neighbors are located in distant corners of the region. The massive issues of traffic and trade will grind any city to a halt, and with no undo button or ability to save your game your city can literally self destruct beyond repair. The patches have fixed some problems, but major problems remain and it will still be a few months I think before the game becomes truly playable for long lengths of time.Original Review:Hello and thank you for reading my review. This is a review of the actual game, and not a rant about DRM, there are hundreds of other reviews covering that already.First is the issue of the state of the game right now, it is near unplayable due to the EA servers being completely unstable. If/when that gets resolved I'll be back to update this review and give it another star (making it a 3 star game).So, besides server connection issues, how is the game? Honestly there is a lot of good in the game ... but also a lot of bad unfortunately.What I like about the game is the updated look and vastly better camera control. You can zoom in really close, rotate the camera to any angle, and tilt the camera as well. This gives you a much better look at your city.I really like that you can build roads in almost any shape, gone are the days you are forced to make straight lines or a jagged diagonal. They've also streamlined some of the mundane aspects of the game like power lines and water pipes, these are all automatically handled by the roads. Speaking of roads, they can now be upgraded and they are actually what determines the zone density. A light road will only have a single lane each direction and will allow low density housing, but if you want medium density you can just upgrade the road to a 2 lane each direction road (4 total) and your houses/commercial/industry can upgrade into medium density. No need to delete roads, no need to bulldoze neighborhoods to re-zone.Another aspect I'm really enjoying is services buildings can be upgraded as well. You can increase the capacity of hospitals, schools, police stations, etc. A nice touch is these services also send out individual vehicles to do their job, it's not just behind the scenes number crunching. You can actually see school buses going out to pick up kids, fire fighters putting out blazes in buildings, and police chasing criminals.So now for the bad, what I don't like. First of all the most obvious is city sizes are dramatically smaller. You can still make a large-ish city population wise (around 250k people) but physical size is very small. You can have multiple cities per region, like in SC4, but they are spread out by large spaces and it's a bit unrealistic to have open fields and forests then in a perfect square you suddenly hit wall to wall skyscrapers.Another issue I have is a lot of building types have been removed, for example power plant options and transportation options. Want a subway system? Sorry, doesn't exist. I have a feeling of dread that EA will come out with these later as paid DLC in fashions similar to The Sims ... very small expansion packs at very high cost, and in huge quantities making a complete game purchase cost into the hundreds of dollars. To be fair, their are some new building types that have not been seen in previous games, mainly the specializations (coal mines, ore mines, oil pumps, etc).I've also been running into quite a few bugs/glitches. One I see frequently is roads not being solid, sections will look like they are slightly under the ground rather than over it. A big problem I've encountered is the UI not loading the graphics or info cards. So for example if I go to place zome parks all the options are shown as a blank box and I have no idea what is what. They'll eventually show up if I wait long enough making me wonder if it has something to do with the constant internet connection required and the servers constantly going down.Multiplayer, the supposed reason for constant online, is more miss than hit. Within a region you can have other people controlling the other cities and these players can trade services and resources. For example if one city has more than enough fire coverage they can loan out their extra fire trucks to another city. Or a coal mining city can provide coal to another city to use as power. The problem with all this is it relies on those people actually being there and working on their cities... if you open up a public game, get some players, then 20 minutes later they disappear you loose all the benefits and you probably will never see those people again. This feature is really only useful if you play only with real life friends, and they all make a commitment to play the game regularly.Overall i think the game can have some fun to it, provided the servers are working, but they've also removed a lot of options and I can't shake that feeling of dread that they are coming via micro-transactions and/or insanely high priced 'expansions' akin to The Sims.tions are shown as a blank box and I have no idea what is what. They'll eventually show up if I wait long enough making me wonder if it has something to do with the constant internet connection required and the servers constantly going down.Multiplayer, the supposed reason for constant online, is more miss than hit. Within a region you can have other people controlling the other cities and these players can trade services and resources. For example if one city has more than enough fire coverage they can loan out their extra fire trucks to another city. Or a coal mining city can provide coal to another city to use as power. The problem with all this is it relies on those people actually being there and working on their cities... if you open up a public game, get some players, then 20 minutes later they disappear you loose all the benefits and you probably will never see those people again. This feature is really only useful if you play only with real life friends, and they all make a commitment to play the game regularly.Overall i think the game can have some fun to it, provided the servers are working, but they've also removed a lot of options and I can't shake that feeling of dread that they are coming via micro-transactions and/or insanely high priced 'expansions' akin to The Sims.

title: A sorry disappointment
body: I've been a long time player of Sim City; my first game came on floppies. So I was eagerly looking forward to this latest release. Unfortunately Sim City - Limited Edition requires a internet connection AT ALL TIMES. I live in a rural area with a low speed and unreliable connection. I am angry that the game is only available to those who can afford (and access) a top-of-the-line connection. So unless you have the very best quality internet connection - DO NOT BUY!

title: TURN OFF THE DRM
body: Potentially great game but it cannot be played due to EA Games Compulsory DRM control with servers that cannot cope. AVOID!!

title: Sad
body: I wanted to like this game, but Cities XL is superior in almost every respect.  The freedom for creativity doesn't exist here.

title: Simcity
body: Simcity is such an amazing game. The graphics look incredible, the gameplay is outstanding, it looks better than the previous games, it has a decent soundtrack. The main reason why people complained was because the online kept shutting down. I highly recommend you to buy this game.

title: Cant Play the Game you payed for
body: Its expected to have a few bugs on launch day, but the day after, the day after that... Come on EA/Maxis.  We payed 60 dollars for a game we cant even enjoy.  Unacceptable.  The servers give you no warning of shutting down and just crash.  Dont expect to play your game for more than an hour without something going wrong or another server crash.

title: Is this game a joke?
body: I got my copy of the game on Tuesday and haven't been able to play since. I've tried countless times to log in to the servers, all without any success. My friend played for 4 hours on Wednesday, then found out yesterday that his city had disappeared. So here we are, three days in and EA/Maxis still can't make their game playable. If the servers were bad before, wait until everyone has the weekend off.

title: Great game.... IF YOU CAN PLAY IT.
body: Since I got the game it was nothing but problems. First of all it wouldn't play because of a Virtualization bug when played on Surface Pro. Had to download a Beta version of Origin to get it to work. Then I finally got the launch screen where I was greeted with ANOTHER update which took about an hour. Finally loaded the game and started the tutorial. The game crashed in the middle of the tutorial and kicked me out completely of the game. When I restarted the game loader was stuck at the updating screen. Finally got past the tutorial(which you can't skip BTW). I now started my own city played for about an Hour, which was actually fun.... Then the game crashed and when I restarted the game my progress was gone. A rage quit ensued. Now I'm trying to play again and I'm waiting for a server queue.Moral of the Story EA sucks and made a Great game crappy!Don't buy until EA fixes all the Server Bugs.

title: Great Game
body: Bought it because about a half a dozen friends and I wanted to try it.  Other than the server problems initially, the game has proved to be entertaining

title: Vaporware
body: I have bought a lot of buggy games but this is simply the worst experience I have ever had.  I have never been able to get onto the servers for more than a minute or two since I bought the game on its release date.Reviewers who have actually gotten into the game (mainly magazines that had access to dedicated pre-release servers) were skeptical of the multiplayer content.  It appeared to be incredibly thin and not add very much to the game.  It is clear now that this was simply a veneer added as an excuse to try to sell the always-online DRM.It is just beyond frustrating to only want to play the game solo and find that one can't play, despite having the game in hand, because no multiplayer server is available for solo play.  Incredible.As an added note, apparently EA spent March 7 turning off product features, so if it ever does work, it will be a shell of its former self.

title: I didn't want to review based on DRM, but I was left no choice.
body: I actually really like almost every aspect of the the game. City size could be bigger but its still a very fun game.I would give it a 9 out of 10 if it worked.The problem is I cannot even play the single player game. The servers get screwy and eventually let me in, BUT THERE IS NO SAVE BUTTON!That's right! When EA servers eventually crash an hour into my game, I lose everything. Thanks EA.Such a shame, a great game completely ruined. EA foolishly did this to prevent piracy, however, everyone I know is going to pirate the game because of the the DRM.Wait until there is an online version of this game, then it will be worth $60 easy.

title: Not enough cloud servers in the world to fix this mess
body: I purchased this in advance due to the alleged availability of the ability to play in Sandbox mode...Well even Sandbox requires you to be online, and the newly implanted (By EA) DRM make it almost impossible for Servers to keep up with this...Game will not run for more than several minutes and then you are dropped, and LOOSE your city....This thing is a hot mess, even after 3 days and four hot patches...Save your money...Even with the $20.00 coupon it is not worth it.

title: Worst Gaming Experience Ever
body: It's hard to believe that in this day and age of technology we still have to deal with garbage like this.EA has made many mistakes over the years, but this game takes the cake.The start of the problems as far as I am concerned was when they set up a pre-order without allowing people to pre-download the game files. So opening day you have thousands of people trying to not only download the game files, but trying to create cities.Second to that was forcing EVERYONE who wants to play (including those that purchased copies on disc) to create an Origin account. Its also worth noting that this game requires an internet connection to play! What's that mean for those that live in areas that have spotty internet, or can't afford broad band? It means this game is not for you, so don't buy it.The next problem is leaving thousands of people in the dark about what exactly is going on as the servers are constantly going down, and when they're up you constantly get booted and it doesn't save your game... The staff at EA were replying on the forums only to the few compliments that were there, and ignoring the slew of complaints, save for the few people that had their posts deleted due to vulgar language (Who can blame them?!).The icing on the cake is the 300+ min wait time to talk to someone in tech support via chat, and god only knows how many hours the wait time is on the phone.I wish I could review the actual game itself, but unfortunately it doesn't work!

title: Should not be in the cloud
body: Game is good only when it works, which is not very often.  Data is stored in the cloud instead of locally so whenever the system is down, the game is unplayable.  Horrible way to game.

title: EA CARES ONLY ABOUT MAKING MONEY
body: This game is a pile of crap. EA only cares about making money, crippling gameplay by forcing you to always be connected to their servers that NEVER WORK because they are scared you will pirate the game. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME

title: Um... EA... I hate you. Officially.
body: I'm in the Navy. Therefore I'm out at sea most of my career. Out at sea it's damn near impossible to get on the internet, & I have absolutely no internet for my gaming laptop. When I bought this game I figured I would need internet to install it, this is EA we're talking about after all(Pshh). I didn't, however, expect to need CONSTANT internet connectivity to run MY ALREADY PURCHASED GAME. So thanks again, EA for boning me, exploiting my money & time, & most of all for sucking all the money you can out of your faithful consumers. I'm sure the rest of the now angry-fan-mob can agree with me. Thank you. Thank you very much.P.S. I feel as though all the 5 star reviews are utter BS scrapped together by the developers or publishers in some hopeless attempt to regain some ground in their F-ed up situation. Let me just remind you EA, you're not on the ground anymore. You're floating in the clouds somewhere with your heads up each others asses. You should all go back to flipping burgers at McDougals. DRM is a joke. & you're a joke.

title: Somewhat good
body: The 24/7 online deal ruined the whole experience due to limited internet. This is a recommended game for anyone that enjoyed the last games.

title: Do not expect the same experience as prior games.
body: Yes, Sim City has had a rocky launch... to say the least.The main problem lies in that this engaging single player game is no longer a single player game. It is now a 100% multiplayer game. This means your save file is really not your save file, it belongs to EA.One thing I loved doing in prior games is going onto Sim City forums and downloading game saves from people who had created amazing cities... usually so I could destroy them... but the point was that they were able to share their work with other people. Thats no longer possible.Another thing is that this is EA we are talking about here... once Sim City stops selling in a couple years, they will turn off the servers and move them to work on a new game. Anything you have saved at that point will be gone completely and forever. This software purchase is more of a software rental.Don't support this.

title: As Far As Customer Experience, It Doesn't Get Much Worse Than This
body: I have always loved the previous Sim City games, and despite previous poor customer experiences I have had with EA, I shelled out the almost $60 for this.Now, 3 days later, after dozens of attempts on my different computers and on different networks, I have STILL not been able to play the game even ONCE.This is because you cannot even play a private, single-player game unless you are connected to EA's servers! And their servers have been pretty much constantly down since the game was released.If you are lucky enough to actually get the game to launch, you MIGHT get 10 minutes of game time to start building your city, but the second your internet connection to the crappy EA servers goes out, you get kicked out of the game and lose all of your work.Yes, truly, I have not been able to play the game enough to fully review the gameplay, but in my view there is no way to remove the quality of the customer experience from the overall product. And as far as that goes, it does not get much worse than 'I payed $60 for this and I can't even use it.'

title: Surprised
body: This is the first simcity game I've ever played, and quite frankly, I'm impressed. (Bought on 3/22/2013)Pros:- quick to load- Private mode so you can build a huge cities on a region.- create or join a game (again this can be set to private which is awesome!)- you get a free game! I got mass effect 3. You can choose from battlefield 3, dead space 3, mass effect 3, bejeweled and a few others.- highly addicting(could be a com as well)- sandbox mode (cheat mode)- automatically saves- no server issues!Cons:- Highly addictive- constant online connection. If your connection hiccups, you have a chance of losing progress.This might be a pro or con:- always need to connect to origin. I've used origin for the sims 3, and personally, I uninstalled it because it always froze while updating, and it was just a horrible experience. But origin must have been updated or something (I'm a bit behind :p) because the interface is so much nicer, and it doesn't slow down my computer anymore. Also you can use the origin web browser and other features while in-game, so you don't have to alt-tab out!Final though: I had trouble deciding if this game was worth it, but I am definitely glad I bought it. I highly recommend this game. Also the city specialization definitely adds a lot more strategy to the game, but you will have to see for yourself :)

title: Won't buy with DRM, online only restrictions
body: I was so excited about this game, too. Glad I didn't buy it. I feel bad for those who did and cannot get a refund.

title: Yeah
body: Yet another person burned by SimCity.  And for me, it's not just the crippling server issues; it's how buggy the game is.  Region trading doesn't work.  Neither does Great Works.  The traffic AI is so bad, it has single-handedly caused me to stop playing.It is blatant that they released SimCity in a state that wasn't even close to release, not by a longshot.  I know I've made some bad purchases in the past, but I can't remember off-hand the last time I felt this burned by a purchase.

title: NEVER WORKS!
body: This game never works. Servers always down and when the game actually works it has a lot of bugs. Streets never want to place correctly. Sometimes you get streets under streets which causes a traffic jam and you have to destroy everything on the street to fix the problem. IF YOU DO NOT HAVE INTERNET YOU CAN NOT PLAY THIS GAME. THIS GAME REQUIRES ACCESS TO SERVERS AT ALL TIMES.

title: Childhood dream ruined
body: Sim city is one of the few video games I have enjoyed in my life but after this mess with the DRM crap I feel like my childhood has been raped and left for dead in the desert
